div.p: During the following times teachers are "in office" and will be available to answer your questions immediately. Otherwise, teachers will respond to questions intermittently throughout the day.
Burbank: 10:00-10:30 Math 11:30 - 12:00 Reading M-F Afternoon times for one-on-one / small group private tutoring

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.a: National Geographic "Explorer Classroom", M-F at 11:00 AM
National Geographic, "Learning is Always Open" activities

div.p: Science Fair Projects are due April 23. Though we won't have a Science Fair, per se, your child's teacher will let his/her students know what fun and creative options students will have to share what they've learned.

p.a: A parent's guide to surviving COVID-19: 8 strategies to keep children healthy and happy.
Exercise Tips to help kids, teens and families stay balanced at home

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: As the COVID-19 crisis continues and the "Stay At Home" order persists, Millville School anticipates, and is currently working toward, offering a form of Distance Learning for all students the week after spring break. As you know, new information and mandates have been coming to us fast and furiously, so our expectations may change depending on new mandates, but please know the staff of Millville School is eager to return to school, in whatever form it takes, and looks forward to fulfilling our purpose of providing a dynamic and meaningful education to all of our students.

The 2020 Shasta County Elementary and Junior High Spelling Bees have been cancelled. All spellers who qualified for this year's Shasta County Spelling Bees are invited to participate in next year's Shasta County Spelling Bees without further qualifying.
Swim Lessons for grades TK, Kindergarten and 1st have been cancelled for April and rescheduled for September 1-11.

em.strong: All current TK, Kindergarten and 1st grade students will participate in the swim lessons in September.

div.p: Parents and students are encouraged to check out the lost and found on the Preschool fence for their lost clothing items and lunch boxes.

Shasta Union High School District Nutrition Services will be serving meals at Millville Elementary School, 12:00 pm to 12:30 pm, March 23rd through April 3rd. Meals are free to children ages 0 to 18. Each child present will receive a breakfast and a lunch. SUHSD is committed to providing excellent high quality lunches and breakfasts with different meal choices each day including PBJ Uncrustable Sandwiches, Gourmet Deli Subs Sandwiches and their Most Excellent Schoolhouse Pizza. Breakfast Items will include Whole Grain Low Sugar, yet delicious, 6 pack Mini Donuts and Whole Grain reduced fat, but flavor filled, double Chocolate Muffins. Fruit, Vegetables and a variety of flavored chilled milks will also be offered with all meals.

ul.li: Projects will be individual rather than partner
Use items from around your home rather than go out to purchase
Alter your project to fit these amendments to the Science Fair guidelines.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: The Millville School Board voted on Tuesday March 17, 2020 to close Millville School at the end of the day Wednesday, March 18 through April 13 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. We expect to resume school on Tuesday, April 14.
Students will receive work packets to do at home, breakfasts and lunches will be provided by request and other services may be available as needed.

Students will be given a packet of classwork containing two weeks’ worth of classwork, which will be due upon our return to school. Parents of students who have been absent may pick up their child’s packet from the classroom teacher on Wednesday or at the school office on Thursday or Friday between 8:00-3:30.

If students should have questions regarding the assignments, they can contact their classroom teacher at any time. Teachers will be checking their email daily. A list of all teachers’ email addresses is below.

Assignment sheets are included in each packet of work and they are also linked below should your child misplace it. Also linked below is another copy of the Science Fair guidelines as working on the Science Fair projects is on many students’ assignment list.
If you would like to check out a book or your child needs to use a computer please contact me at mrs.desantis@millvilleschool.net and I will arrange a time to meet you at the school.

p.strong: We will continue to update information on this website as it becomes available.

div.p: We thank you for your patience as we have carefully sorted through the myriad of new information that has come to us by the hour in order to determine what is in the best interest of our students. What we are experiencing now is a most unprecedented set of circumstances, but we are traveling this road together, which makes us all the stronger.
If you have any questions, please email me at the above address; I’ll be checking email frequently.
Take care of yourselves and your families; we look forward to seeing you in April.

div.p: Please call the school and ask for either Mr. Mangum or Mr. Roberts if you have any bus related questions.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Teachers use more than just test scores to determine how well a student is doing, because test scores alone don’t tell the whole story. And the same is true for schools – test scores are only part of a bigger picture of school success. That’s why the California School Dashboard contains a range of easy-to-use, color-coded gauges designed to give families a complete picture of a school or district. The Dashboard includes meaningful data on graduation rates, college/career readiness, attendance, English learner progress, suspensions and more. The state has created several videos – translated into Spanish – to help you learn about the Dashboard and how to use it. Find them on the California Department of Education’s YouTube channel!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: The Mission of Millville Elementary School is to instill in our students an enthusiasm for learning.

ul.li: Provide our students with a high quality education;
Offer all students an introduction to the arts;
Create an environment of respect for one another, and

div.p: ...with the intent to guide our students to becoming productive, responsible citizens.

h3.div: Our purpose is to develop students who are lifelong learners by providing quality, standards-based education through a caring staff, supportive families, and an involved community.

div.p: Founded in 1856, Millville Elementary School District is a firmly established and integral member of the small, rural ranching community of Millville. Located just 15 miles east of Redding, Millville School has a current enrollment of approximately 250 students, kindergarten through 8th grade. Our small school atmosphere allows us to get to know every student and to provide an education that caters to each students’ individual needs.

At Millville School, our purpose is to develop a love of learning in our students by providing a high-quality, standards-based education that is enhanced by arts, music, clubs and sports. We strive to create an educational environment that provides the basis for participation in a democratic society by promoting critical thinking, developing a sense of responsibility and self esteem, encouraging independence of opinion and action, and nurturing respect for others.

Providing a quality and comprehensive education for our students is only achievable through the efforts of our professional and caring staff, supportive families, and an involved community. It is through the combined efforts of our staff and community, on behalf of our students, that Millville School truly is “A Great Place to Learn”.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Millville Elementary School | 8570 Brookdale Road, Millville, CA 96062 | P: (530) 547-4471 | F: (530) 547-3760
